item.title: Benchmarking AWS Instances with MNIST classification
item.description: In a previous post I have shown you how to setup an AWS instance running the newest RStudio, R, Python, Julia and so forth, where the configuration of the instance can be freely chosen. However, there is quite a lot of possibilities of instance configurations out there: There are different instance classes (General Purpose, Compute Optimized, RAM Optimized, â€¦ ) and different instance sizes within these classes. For General Purpose, or t2, there are, e.
